p: This study revealed that about half of the respondents were moderately to very much concerned about their occupational health and safety when working during very hot weather. The percentage (50 %) concerned in those participants employed in the “agriculture, forestry and fishing” industry in this study was about 6 times higher than that (8 %) in a study of Californian hired farmworkers in the USA [ 27]. The relatively higher heat awareness among the Australian workplace may reflect cultural and demographic differences in study populations.
